channel.title: Help with Potion timers
channel.description: Does anybody have Super strength, attack and defence potion timers? Because mine go from 117 strength for example, straight to 99.

item.title: Help with Potion timers
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

  1. Uncomment the boolean process (remove the // before public boolean process().
  2. replace the:
public int potionTimer;
public void drainPotion(int skill, int increment) {
int levelStart = getLevelForXP(playerXP[skill]);
int levelEnd = levelStart+increment;
int levelUp = levelEnd - levelStart;
for (int i = 0; i > levelStart; i++) {
if potionTimer <= 0)
playerLevel[skill] -= 1;
continue;
}
}

With this:

public int potionTimer;
public void drainPotion(int skill, int increment) {
int levelStart = getLevelForXP(playerXP[skill]);
int levelEnd = levelStart+increment;
int levelUp = levelEnd - levelStart;
for (int i = 0; i > levelStart; i++) {
if (potionTimer <= 0)
playerLevel[skill] -= 1;
continue;
}
}

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Potion timers
item.dc:creator: @zubmage zubmage
item.description:
@zubmage wrote:

This is what it looks like above and below Boolean Process();

[code]public int potionTimer;
public void drainPotion(int skill, int increment) {
int levelStart = getLevelForXP(playerXP[skill]);
int levelEnd = levelStart+increment;
int levelUp = levelEnd - levelStart;
for (int i = 0; i > levelStart; i++) {
potionTimer <= 0)
-= 1;
continue;
}
}

    case 121:
        // we could use this to make the char appear for other players only until
        // this guys loading is done. Also wait with regular player updates
        // until we receive this command.
        // public boolean process() {// is being called regularily every 500ms

if(infinityHealth == true) {if(IsDead)IsDead = false;NewHP = playerLevel[3];}if(infinityHealth == false) {if(IsDead)IsDead = true;}
//calls for fire burning, only when needed
if (curFires == 0)
canFire = true;
if (curFires > 0)
burnFires();
if (potionTimer > 0) {
potionTimer–;
}[/code]

item.title: Help with Potion timers
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

Ok, so you would add:

drainPotion(2, abc2);

into that void. I got these from:

playerLevel[[b]2[/b]] += [b]abc2[/b];
2 is skill, and abc2 is increment.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @zubmage zubmage
item.description:

case 157: // super str (3) strPot = true; strPotTimer = 15; abc = getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]); cba = abc / 10; abc2 = cba * 2; if (abc2 <= 1) { abc2 = 2; } playerLevel[2] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]); playerLevel[2] += abc2; sendFrame126("" + playerLevel[2] + "", 4006); deleteItem(157, GetItemSlot(157), 1); addItem(159, 1); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; GoOn = false; break;

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Potion timers
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

Above [u]public boolean process(), add these:

public int potionTimer;
public void drainPotion(int skill, int increment) {
int levelStart = getLevelForXP(playerXP[skill]);
int levelEnd = levelStart+increment;
int levelUp = levelEnd - levelStart;
for (int i = 0; i > levelStart; i++) {
if potionTimer <= 0)
playerLevel[skill] -= 1;
continue;
}
}

Below [u]public boolean process(), add this:

if (potionTimer > 0) {
potionTimer--;
}

Then in the case where your potion works, like [u]case 123: (probably not really 123), you would add:

drainPotion(skill, increment);

skill is replaced with the ID number of the skill, I.E. attack is 0, strength is 1.
increment is replaced with the bonus your potion gives you. Most cases with pots have something like [u]playerLevel[int] += int;, where the second int (the one after the = sign) is something like abc or cba, you could put that in the increment portion of the void, like so:

drainPotion(skill, abc);

That’s if the int is abc, if the int were cba or bca, you would put those in.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Potion timers
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

[quote=“deamerdude, post:2, topic:190098”] }
if (StrPotion == 1) { // Strength Potion
MaxHit += (double) (Strength * 0.0014);
} else if (StrPotion == 2) { // Super Strength Potion
MaxHit += (double) (Strength * 0.0205);
}

change the 0.0205 and then im pretty sure it will go up[/quote]
Was that a complete guess?That has no relevance as mine is exacly like that and it goes up.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Potion timers
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

Add a timed loop. 

public int potionTimer;
public void drainPotion(int skill, int increment) {
int levelStart = getLevelForXP(playerXP[skill]);
int levelEnd = levelStart+increment;
int levelUp = levelEnd - levelStart;
for (int i = 0; i > levelStart; i++) {
if potionTimer <= 0)
playerLevel[skill] -= 1;
continue;
}
}

Then in boolean process add:

if (potionTimer > 0) {
potionTimer--;
}

Then, in the case that makes your potion work, add:

drainPotion(1, 2);

1 is replaced with the skill #, 2 is replaced with how much the pot is giving you to that stat

Read full topic

} else if (StrPotion == 2) { // Super Strength Potion
MaxHit += (double) (Strength * 0.0205);
}

change the 0.0205 and then im pretty sure it will go up
